page.title: 05THE ELDERLY
page.content: We interviewed Mrs Carol Brown of 3 Carloggas Close,about the Friendship Group. Mrs Brown started the group in 1977.The Group provides enjoyment,entertainment,and a monthly outing.Each member pays 15 pence a week.Mrs Brown makes and sells soft toys to help the funds.Ages in the group vary from 69 to the 90 year old Mrs Glover.Mrs Brown enjoys running the group,and nursed for 40 years. There are 20 members,and meetings are held in Mrs Brown's house every Monday from 2.30 - 4.30.Croquet and cards are popular with the members. I interviewed the Warden in charge of 12 bungalows,purpose built for the elderly 7 years ago at Carloggas.There are 20 mainly local married couples. She provides the meals for some,runs them to the doctor /dentist,and checks them daily.
